intro: Impatiens lemannii subsp. kurramensis, commonly known as the Kurram impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of Pakistan. It is characterized by its vibrant red flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
